# of participants: 45 DS subjects, 45 age-matched cognitively normal subjects
Method: Eyes-closed resting EEG data collected, with EOG.
Findings: Central, parietal, occipital, and temporal cortex had alpha and beta rhythms with lower amplitude in DS, while delta rhythms were higher in amplitude in DS.

# of participants: 12 with DS/AD/myoclonic epilepsy, over the age of 40
Method: Long-term EEG monitoring during sleep and wake, with EMG and EKG.
Findings: 3 stages of epilepsy were found: diffuse abnormalities during sleep with dementia onset, myoclonic epilepsy, and finally non-epileptic myoclonus with severe dementia.

# of participants: 21 with DS and dementia, 16 with DS and no dementia
Method: EEG during wake resting state, with EOG and EKG.
Findings: Decreased theta band frequencies in several regions of the brain are correlated with cognitive deterioration based on the Dementia Screening Questionnaire in Intellectual Disability.
